name: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back

reviews.content: A stunning and fascinating fantasy tale in which some valiant heroes battle the Galactic Empire and they prepare to fight the evil Darth Vader and the forces of the Dark Side .¨The Empire strikes again" is a timeless classic competently directed by Irvin Keshner , considered to be the best of the exciting trilogy . Riveting second entry George Lucas's Stars Wars from a fantastic trilogy proved to be one of the biggest boxoffice successes of all time . This super-colossal Sci-Fi epic , it is a real and spectacular pantomime . And , like most pantomimes , it is a lot of fun and extremely entertaining . Concerning the young heroe named Luke : Mark Hamill , a hot-shot, cocky aircraft pilot, Han Solo, the previously captured and rescued Princess Leia and a mysterious Jedi Knight, Ben Obi Wan Kenobi , all of them blend together against the tyrants of the Galactic Empire . After destruction of the Rebel base on icy Hoth , Han Solo , Princess Leia and Chewbacca escape in the Millennium Falcon , eventually finding dubious sanctuary in the city of Bespin. Along the way , Luke learns the ways of a Jedi knight from master Yoda : Frank Oz , while Han : Harrison Ford , Leia : Carrie Fisher find time for romance and a few adventures of their own . As the brave team attempting to save the galaxy from the Empire's World by trying to destroy the enemy armada , while Han Solo is captured by the ominous enemy , Darth Vader : David Prowse and his Stormtroopers. The Adventure Continues...The Star Wars saga continues..The battle continues... . May the Force be will you!. ¨Somewhere, in space, this could all be happening right now" .¨A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away". It's Back ! .The Force will be with you for three weeks only. May the Force be with you. One year old today !.The plot is well known , a group of valiant heroes join forces to combat evil forces , they're the following ones : the reckless Luke Skywalker : Mark Hamill , a sly , likeable pilot : Harrison Ford, a shaggy Wookie, Chewbacca : Peter Mayhew , a beautiful princess : Carrie Fisher , a Jedi Knight , Obi Wan Kenobi : Alec Guinness, and two endearing pair of droids , C3PO : Anthony Daniels and R2D2 : Kenny Baker, both of whom accompany the hero on his exploits and other rebel forces engaged in a life and death struggle, while trying to save Han Solo from the claws of the mysterious Darth Vader : David Prowse, voice by James Earl Jones and other enemies as the Emperor , Boba Fett , Grand Moff Tarkin , or Jabba . Introduces the charismatic Lando Calrissian : Billy Dee Williams and a mind-numbing secret from Darth Vader . Offers the same superb special effects and hearty plot as set by 1977's magnificent Star Wars. Set a new cinematic standard for realistic but at the same time traditional special effects, including overwhelming battles , impressive monsters , groundbreaking aerial scenes galore , though subsequently several frames were digitalized by I. L. M. (Industrial , Light and Magic) , making many pre-Stars Wars flicks seem almost laughable in retrospective.Writer/producer/filmmaker George Lucas and director Irvin Kershner mixed the best of vintage Science Fiction of the Fifties , pulp literature, old-fashionable cliff-hungers , comic books, Akira Kurosawa films and classic fantasy to come up with the ultimate and overwhelming adventure . It displays wonderful settings, glamorous production design by Michael Ford , monumental art direction by Norman Reynolds and splendid costumes by John Mollo . As well as colorful and brilliant cinematography by Peter Suschitzky. And a vibrant and rousing musical score by the great John Williams, including the classic leitmotif . The movie's adrenaline-raising drive makes it irresistible. Being essential and indispensable watching it . Followed by the inferior "Return of the Jedi" by Richard Marquand with similar artistic and technician team.
reviews.heading: Riveting and excellent second picture in the epic Star Wars trilogy finds young Luke and the Rebel Alliance plotting new strategies

reviews.content: The Empire starts a systematic search as they look to avenge their earlier losses and finally end the threat of the Rebel Alliance.The Rebel hideout on ice planet Hoth is finally exposed and the heroes are forced to flee for their lives. But just as they think they are safe an old friend is forced into betrayal.There are three major settings in the second installment of the regional trilogy, Hoth, Dagobah and Bespin. Although the action is (mostly) limited to these locations they are drawn with such care and attention to detail you don't feel any limitation or claustrophobia. The Ice planet feels enormous, the swamp planet truly alive like no other and the cloud giant plain different.The second instalment of the series sees more character development, some passive and some active. This greatly enhance the movie and allows e audience greater insight into the drives and motivations of the motley group. Producing Yoda in such a way that he is easily to accept as a character rather than a puppet was no mean feat and the voice talents of Frank Oz unquestionably breathe life into a pivotal character.The inner darkness that Luke has to fight (actual and metaphorical) is well engineered, could even upset some younger viewers.Vader and Luke's showdown in Cloud City is cinema legend!The two droids are split up but still the central line of the plot, all be it forked into the twin stories of Leia/Han/C-3PO and Luke/R2-D2. This allows the two robots the chance to grow in the hearts of the viewers too, less of a comedy double act. Having said that they still get most of the funny bits.R2-D2's discomfort on Dagobah is palpable. Not bad for a droid that doesn't speak (English).This movie does feel the absence of a movie monolith like Peter Cushing or Alec Guinness. Yes, the latter is present as a apparition but it isn't the same. The primary cast do step up though and pull the viewer on and into the story.Things to look out for: eh? Can you spot Pixar favourite John Ratzenberger?, inside a Tauntan, Yoda, Ghostly Ben, carbonite, Boba Fett, AT-AT, Snow Speeder (my personal favourite in Star Wars), Battle for Hoth, Dagobah swamps, final showdown and amazing reveal.
reviews.heading: Good strong continuation of the story

reviews.content: If you haven't seen The Empire Strikes Back yet, stop what you're doing and watch it right now! This film is the epitome of a timeless classic and a must-see for any movie lover. Even if you're not a Star Wars fan, the plot, characters, and special effects will captivate you from beginning to end.The Empire Strikes Back takes us deeper into the Star Wars universe and introduces us to new worlds, creatures, and characters, including the legendary Jedi Master, Yoda. The story follows the Rebel Alliance as they face their toughest challenge yet: the evil Empire has regrouped and is hunting them down. Meanwhile, Luke Skywalker is on a journey to discover the truth about his past and become a Jedi Knight.What makes The Empire Strikes Back stand out from the rest of the Star Wars movies is its darker tone and complex storytelling. The characters face real challenges and the stakes are higher than ever before. The relationships between the characters are also more nuanced, especially the dynamic between Luke, Leia, and Han. And who could forget the iconic plot twist that shocked audiences around the world?One of the things that sets The Empire Strikes Back apart is its stunning visual effects. From the epic battle scenes to the breathtaking landscapes, every shot is a work of art. The music by John Williams is also top-notch and adds to the overall experience.In conclusion, The Empire Strikes Back is a masterpiece of cinema and a true gem in the Star Wars franchise. It's a film that you can watch over and over again and still discover new things to appreciate. As Yoda would say, "Do or do not. There is no try." So, do yourself a favor and watch this film ASAP!Fun Fact: The famous "I love you" - "I know" exchange between Han Solo and Princess Leia was actually ad-libbed by Harrison Ford during filming.
reviews.heading: The Empire Strikes Back: A Classic That Lives Up To The Hype

reviews.content: What else is there to say....it's Star Wars, the best Star Wars films. In my opinion it's one of the few perfect movies out there. There is nothing you can change that could make it better. The casting, music, story, dialog.....it's all perfect. The action is great without hampering the plot. The lines are iconic. Perhaps the writing in The Empire Strikes Back is the most iconic over any other Star Wars film. On this last rewatch I was still so amazed with how well the special effects were. Like how do that pull this stuff off in 1980!?!?! I just wished the prequels or the sequels could have captured just a little of the magic. I miss it so much, the original trilogy is still so magical!!!
reviews.heading: After Thoughts

reviews.content: We now come to the empire strikes back. For some reason in this movie we start in hoth for some unknown reason but im glad we do as we get to see a new planet, sights and villians. This time in the form of the brief snowtroopers and the gigantic atat;s snowspeeders and their well designed shape come into it aswell. As always our double act r2d2 and c3po are on the lookout together for their own plot. I liked the design of cloud city and to me is one of the grratrst designed in the series. It was great seeing williams, lando and bobo fett make an apprences and who wouldve guessed the twist near the end of the film that blew audiances minds. Overall the empire strikes back is a great follow up with yet more unforgettable performances and great galatic fighting action ,while the overall story becomes darker as we go.
reviews.heading: another great continuation

reviews.content: This movie, about Luke Skywalker who begins his Jedi training with Yoda, while his friends are pursued across the galaxy by Darth Vader and bounty hunter Boba Fett, is a good sequel to Star Wars (1977).First of all, the story is even closer to the Force compared to the previous movie, and Luke has already been starting to have a better relationship with it. But still, he was an impatient man who focused more on what was possible or not rather than the belief of necessity where trying was more important than doing. It was exciting to see him evolve, both (soon) as a Jedi Knight and a person himself, and jump right into dangerous challenges, mainly for his friends, but also for himself. The meeting between him and Vader was interesting, especially with their lightsaber fight, which was pleasantly faster than the first movie, and of course their verbal conflict. However, like in the first movie, this one has unfortunately some slow scenes, especially the Dagobah scenes, and the Cloud City scenes (except from the fight between Luke and Vader), which makes some feeling of boredom, even though they were also entertaining. The technical aspects are great, especially the sets and the sound effects, and they truly give a good, cinematic experience.In conclusion, this is a well-executed sequel where the story is more focused on the Force, and it's exciting to see Luke evolve both as a Jedi Knight and a person. The film has its slow moments, but the technical aspects, such as the sets and sound effects, are impressive and provide a great cinematic experience.
reviews.heading: Closer to the Force

reviews.content: Arguably the best film from the original trilogy (and entire Star Wars saga), The Empire Strikes Back strikes a more mature tone than it's predecessor; still fantastical and exploring a labyrinth of imagination that you could get lost in, but delving deeper into the mysticism of the force and division between good and evil.Some of the most famous quotes and scenes in cinema history are found within these two hours, influential and replicated or parodied countless times. It's difficult to find someone not aware of the film's 'twist', even if they haven't seen the film, and that cultural impact shows what a behemoth this film is. The storytelling takes an almighty step forward with these plot points, keeping the story engrossing and well paced.Empire sees the introduction of some of the most recognisable characters in media; fan favourites who's mannerisms and qualities endure beyond the film. Without losing any of the core characters from A New Hope, these new characters are integrated well, having meaningful contributions to the story and wider context, without overwhelming screentime.Relationships develop tenfold, creating more chemistry between all the characters, new and old. Whilst more apparent arcs of friendship, romance, and betrayal flourish, smaller interactions between less noticeable relationships show the evolution off screen - such as Chewbacca and C3PO. Leia in particular is given the opportunity to stamp her personality in the film, even more so than previously - an excellent character leading the way instead of falling into the royal category of damsel in distress.Once again, the settings as magnificent, none more so than the original locations in the likes of Hoth and Dagobah. Cloud CIty benefits from Lucas' later edits, but these built sets create such an atmosphere. These are supported by the costuming, props and puppetry, which are as iconic as the heroes utilising them.The soundtrack is still excellent and transitions the story between scenes so well. Overall, the whole film is a little more seamless, and it is the perfect film building upon an unbeatable foundation.
reviews.heading: The Evolution & Expansion of Star Wars

reviews.content: I dont even know what to say i just know that this movie helped me at my lowest points got me out of a depression and i have the entire thing memorized i love this movie so bad. Literally would do anything for it i love being a dramatic 15 year old lesbian who absolutely adores the empire strikes back. Live laugh love the empire strikes back. When in doubt watch the empire strikes back. Think youre crazy?? I type the e and empire then strikes back immediately show up maybe i need to tell my psychologist about this i dont know!!!!!!!! Anyways moral of the story is i needed to get the required characters and i love the empire strikes back more than my life and more than anyone else does.
reviews.heading: i love the empire strikes back.

reviews.content: ***spoilers ahead***Easily the best Star wars movie to date. Action packed adventure following Luke Skwalker, as he tries to ecaspe not only the clutches of the evil empire but also his own destiny as the last Jedi knight in training. Colourful characters, epic space battles and one of the greatest land assault scenes you'll ever see in cinema. Bu that all pales in comparison to the epic fight finalie between the hero and the villain.Never before in cinema had an audience been so invested in the characters, thinking they knew who was good and who was evil, until the fatal moment when Darth Vader uttered the immortal lines "No! I am your father"The Legend was born!
reviews.heading: The first great plot twist

reviews.content: I have given only a handful of 10s out in my lifetime. This movie is one of the few. Most people who have seen it once have seen it multiple times. I have probably watched this movie 20 or so times in full. The words "Timeless Classic" do not do this film justice. This movie is better than anything that has come out in the 21st century. It is simply one of the greatest movies of all time.In the first film, Lucas built up a world that nobody has ever experienced before. Talks of legendary Jedi and the force were held, and it only added to the greatness that is A New Hope (Or The Star Wars if that upsets you). However, that world that was built was not explored. It forced Lucas to take on one of the most dangerous tasks in all of filmmaking. Create a sequel to one of the greatest movies ever made.If you have somehow not watched a Star Wars movie and want to get into it, please do. I don't know many people who love movies that have seen Star Wars and don't love the first two movies at the least.
reviews.heading: The Greatest Sequel of All Time

reviews.content: Star Wars - Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back is a slow burning, character driven movie that really puts the heart in Star Wars. There's not too much action present, but that's lots of romantic moments, and amazing dialogue showing the characters grow and mature. The musical score is some of the best in the franchise, with the themes really hitting hard in a lot of moments. Han and Leia's relationship really grows in this film, as their stranded in space on the heels of the Imperial fleet. Luke finally gets some proper, though unfinished, training. Yoda is back in this film, cleverly testing Luke's patience, and finally deciding to train him. It's overall a great film.
reviews.heading: A Slow Burning, Character Driven Film That Puts The Heart In Star Wars

reviews.content: Yavin 4 had been discovered so they fled, three years later and it's Hoth where rebels tread, Luke Skywalker's on patrol, when a Wampa takes control, leaves him hanging in its cave to have with bread. He escapes into the blizzard and the cold, has a vision from a friend where he is told, seek to train from Master Yoda, find him on planet Dagobah, Han arrives, and slips him in a Tauntaun fold. A droid informs the Empire what it's found, leaves the rebels little time to hang around, first protect the energy field, that provides the bases shield, as off to Hoth, Imperial forces bound.It's a game of cat and mouse, as the rebels seek to avoid capture and Luke develops his Jedi skills while learning some pertinent family history but becomes a little less dexterous (for the time being).
reviews.heading: One for All & All for One...

reviews.content: This is Tim Robbins best performance ever. It is a compelling heart warming drama about an innocent man(Andy Dufresbe) who is sent to prison and learns to use his intelligence to make the best of prison life. He meets a mentor in Red(Morgan Freeman) and they build a friendship that is stronger than the walls that surround them. Andy steadies a relationship with the warden that keeps him in the good eyes of the prison. Andy is full of surprises and uses his resourcefulness to not only win the friendships of his fellow prisoners, but also of the prison guards. Both Andy and Red both hold on to their dream of one day enjoying their freedom. They turn their friendship and dreams of freedom into a bond that no prison could ever take away.
reviews.heading: Love it

reviews.content:
Not just the best Star Wars movie by far... not even one of the best sequels ever... but strong contender for greatest movie of all time.Empire benefits hugely by being a middle story in the then trilogy, its left free to kick off without introduction
and end without conclusion. Three years earlier the world had been taken by storm with the original Star Wars , later dubbed Star Wars : A New Hope, but this time around it was more than a Flash Gordon inspired space opera, this is high shakesperian drama with a back drop of a galaxy far far away. Its genius was to take its (by now) lovable heroes and throw them into deepest darkest turmoil. The snow battle, the asteroid chase, Yoda, Boba Fett, the lightsaber duel, the big reveal and that cliffhanger ending. Star wars (a new hope) may have introduced a whole generation to ciema but the sequel is why we fell in love with the movies.
reviews.heading: Possibly the greatest film of all time

reviews.content: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back is a timeless classic that continues to captivate audiences more than four decades after its release. Directed by Irvin Kershner and written by Lawrence Kasdan and George Lucas, the film picks up where the first Star Wars left off, with the Rebel Alliance struggling to defeat the evil Galactic Empire.What follows is an epic space adventure filled with thrilling action sequences, unforgettable characters, and iconic moments that have become a part of pop culture. From the snow-covered planet of Hoth to the swamps of Dagobah and the menacing corridors of the Death Star, the film takes us on a journey through a vast and imaginative universe that has become synonymous with the Star Wars franchise.The Empire Strikes Back also features some of the most memorable characters in movie history, including Luke Skywalker (Mark Hamill), Princess Leia (Carrie Fisher), and Han Solo (Harrison Ford), as well as the iconic villain Darth Vader (voiced by James Earl Jones). The performances are pitch-perfect, and the chemistry between the characters is electric, making us root for them as they fight to save the galaxy.But what really sets The Empire Strikes Back apart is its rich and complex storytelling, which explores themes of love, loss, and redemption. The film takes risks and subverts expectations, with a twist ending that shocked audiences and changed the course of the Star Wars saga forever.Even after all these years, The Empire Strikes Back remains a masterpiece of science fiction and a true classic of cinema. Its unforgettable characters, thrilling action, and rich storytelling continue to inspire and entertain audiences of all ages. Whether you're a die-hard Star Wars fan or a newcomer to the franchise, this film is a must-see.
reviews.heading: The Empire Strikes Back - A Timeless Classic That Continues to Captivate Audiences

reviews.content: An exciting sequel to the original "Star Wars", this has certain elements in it that are a bit better better the original, although there's no improving on that classic. The original film gave the audience an opportunity to get to know Hans Solo, Luke Skywalker and Princess Leia as well as robots C3 PO and RQDQ and villain. Darth Vader. The time has been taken for the sequel to really flesh those characters out, and the result means that the audience will root for the 3 heroes all the more even though they had loyalty from the start. There's an amusing battle of the sexes presented with the obviously attracted Leia (Carrie Fisher) and Hans (Harrison Ford), and the youthful Luke (Mark Hamill) truly has become a man after winning the battle against the Death Star. With his rise to power as the main villain, Darth Vader is all the more fascinating, and James Earl Jones is even more commanding than he was before.While I do not consider the original "Star Wars" a B movie in any way, and certainly one of the best films of all time let alone science fiction film, the three Years in between films have given an opportunity for the special effects to truly get better, not that they were shabby in the first place, but now they are more sophisticated and even more riveting, and that makes the film more exciting on the action scale. So an already classic film has become all the more memorable with elements that the 1st film didn't get the chance to reveal, Including the now classic plot twist of just who darth data really is. Alec Guinness continues to advise Luke from beyond as Obi-Wan, but he obviously could do this in his sleep, so it's just a nice little cameo to bring some heart and fatherly advice to Luke since he obviously wouldn't get that from his own father. The search for Yoda adds another interesting creature to the series, and fans of the Muppets will be thrilled by his voice.There is still some delightful silliness, as the relationship between C3PO and R2-D2 takes on some touching elements of protection from one to the other, and as complex as certain elements of the story are , the film is delightfully easy to follow even for non fans of science fiction. While Fisher still has a humorous looking hairstyle, the cinnamon bun look is gone, and her attractiveness becomes all the more apparent. In a sense, the acting skills of the three leads has greatly approved, and thus along a somewhat better script, I can see why some viewers have attributed this to be shakespearian in nature which of course comes out in the elements that are revealed about Luke's past. The battle sequence with Luke going after the legs of the walking battleships is brilliant, taking movie art direction to a much more complex level. Certainly one of the greatest sequels ever made, and nearly as classic as the original.
reviews.heading: New acquaintances in 1977 became old beloved friends in 1980.

reviews.content: The Empire Strikes Back is the second installment of the Star Wars franchise released in 1980 and widely regarded as everyone's favorite!! This film wins this monicker because - unlike most sequels that try to repeat the original & fail - Empire, as most Star Wars fans affectionately call it, delves deeper into the character's psychology & the film introduces new, cool characters such Yoda, Boba Fett, & Lando Calrissian that spark our interest!! The film takes us in different directions & to different planets & one of the things - in an odd way that is satisfying to the audience - is that on the surface the evil Empire WINS in the end making this one of the few American movies to my knowledge where this happens!! Extremely well directed by Star Wars creator George Lucas' late mentor the late Irvin Kershner, Empire has outstanding performances by all its actors with classic lines that still permeate American culture today!! Excellent special effects, a soundtrack that is second-to-none by legend John Williams and a set up for a very satisfying sequel film make The Empire Strikes Back the strongest film of the franchise!! My rare 9 out of 10 stars!!
reviews.heading: Simply The Best When It Comes To Star Wars Movies!!

reviews.content: The Empire Strikes Back is an absolute classic science fiction film released back in 1980. It continues the story of Luke Skywalker, Princess Leia, and Han Solo as they battle the evil Galactic Empire.One of the many strengths of this film is its intricate and well-developed plot, which includes numerous engaging twists and turns. The film's visual effects and breathtaking action sequences are mesmerizing, and are elevated by John Williams' iconic musical score.The Empire Strikes Back also delves deeper into the mythos of the Star Wars universe, introducing legendary characters such as Yoda, and exploring the concept of the Force in greater detail. The film's central themes of temptation, sacrifice, and redemption are expertly explored through the character arcs of the protagonists, making this installment both emotionally satisfying and thought-provoking.On a technical level, the film is an undeniable triumph, with excellent production design, costumes, and special effects that hold up even by today's standards. The performances of the cast, especially Mark Hamill as Luke Skywalker, are also standout.In conclusion, The Empire Strikes Back is a masterful and groundbreaking film that is a must-see for fans of science fiction and action. Its timeless appeal and impact on popular culture cannot be overstated, and it remains a favorite of mine to this day which is why I've rated it a 9 out of 10.
reviews.heading: A Masterful, Groundbreaking, & Timeless Film with Mesmerizing Effects and Standout Performances by Hamill & Co.

reviews.content: The first three installments of the Star Wars series of films are easily the best three of the entire series; and this film, The Empire Strikes Back, is the best of the top three. If for no other reason, the development and dramatic impact of the Darth Vader character within this film sets it apart from all the others. When Vader utters those famous five words in a battle scene, we remember them for the rest of our lives. The intensity of this film is greater than the first or third one (and far more than the latter entries). Not one, but a trio of characters, are fleshed out in this film more than in any other Star Wars entry. Obiwan, Luke, and Vader all have great character development. The music is outstanding, the cinematography is outrageously good, and the script is more sophisticated than the first entry. Don't miss the best of the Stars Wars films.What idiots thought that Pulp Fiction or Fight Club were better films than this one? There are probably 99 out of 100 people who think this film is better.
reviews.heading: Best of the Star Wars Films - The Empire Strikes Back

reviews.content: Empire strikes back is the best star wars movie because it does everything sequel should do. She expands the star wars world and teaches us more about it. There are good actors and George Lucas is the director and writer in this film. In my opinion, this is the best acting star wars movie. She is also so much different from New Hope. When New hope was a happy and bright movie, Empire strikes back was dark and not afraid to do something new and dark. Also this is the first movie that Yoda is in. Special affect in this film is amazing during the 1980s, everything that happens in space is amazing and the practical affect in this film is gg. Yoda is, in my opinion, the best character ever made in movie history. The movie doesn't end on a good note for our protagonists, I think so because then we get a good ending in the next movie.
reviews.heading: Best Star wars movie ever.

reviews.content: Trilling, excitement adventure. Yep this is what many consider to be the best Star Wars film and it's not hard to see why. Not just a great movie but an amazing sequel. Filled a great cast of Heroes and Villains. The effects 45 years later are still pretty amazing with amazing sets and puppetry work by Frank Oz, an amazing opening scene with tons of action and an ending that ends bitter sweet yet somber. Not to mention one of the best movie twist in history, with of course the only huge issue with the twist is even non Star Wars fans know what it is due to pop culture but that's basically a testament to how great it is.
reviews.heading: The Peak of Star Wars

reviews.content: One of the greatest films of all time, the perfect mix of adventure, action, comedy, sci-fi with a dark tone and easily one of the biggest twist reveals that has ever been in a film. This movie will last forever and has been enjoyed for generations and will be for countless more.Usually sequels aren't as good as the original, yet this film is arguably the best of the original trilogy, the original trilogy forever changed the way movies were made and created an entire franchise that has stretched on for years and will continue to bring enjoyment to millions of people.. if somehow you're watching these for the first time enjoy, you won't be disappointed.
reviews.heading: An amazing film and a timeless masterpiece.

reviews.content: This would have gotten ten stars if it wasn't for the end I hate stories that end on cliff hangers. Otherwise the entire story was great when I first watched it and nowdays. If you are watching the orginal trilogie you will probably like this movie a lot and be eager to watch the last of the trilogie. I simply must get into spoilers. There is a weird love triangle between Leah, Han, and Luke which was killing me the first time I watched it. How is the story writer going to pull this off. And there is of course the famous ligne of Vader (if you don't know the one I'm not telling you) Sorry for breaking the no spoiler rule but this is too good of a film.
reviews.heading: This would have gotten ten stars if it wasn't for the end

reviews.content: Although the Death Star is destroyed, the war against the Republic has just begun. The Empire Strikes Back I must say is quite easily better than it's previous, A New Hope. The AT-AT attack scene at Hoth is the scene I crave most. The rest compared to that scene is pretty good, including Yoda's first appearance, Cloud City, and of course, "I am your father." It's interesting that this Irvin Kershner replaces George Lucas for the directing (I almost assumed Lucas directed all six films). Overall, the action scenes were great (the AT-AT scene being phenomenal), the acting was great, and I also thought some of the humor was better, especially with C-3PO. A well done and thought out movie once again.
reviews.heading: An obviously well done sequel.

reviews.content: After destroying the Death Star the Empire regroups. Aboard his space yacht , Darth Vader sends probe droids that even Apple wouldn't sanction to every backwater in the universe. All while dealing with the general incompetence of his military troops.The rebels have left Yavin for the sub zero wasteland paradise of Hoth. Han and Luke are riding the local " horses" setting a perimeter when a big rock comes crashing down. Han says it's cold and the base has a Starbucks.Luke decides to see if the rock is like all the others he has seen in the galaxy.While looking at the rock his " horse" smells trouble. A big scary cave dwelling monster , who loves " horse " meat. It kills the horse and drags Luke back to its cave for a snack later. Meanwhile , Han and Leia are bickering about the same old nonsense , his not being older than 15 and her not ever having kissed a Wookiee. Things grow silent and Han gets ready to leave. Then 3po shows up and says Luke is not home yet.Han realizes something has happened and charges out to rescue Luke who is having a therapeutic seance with Obi-Wan . Han pulls up and saves Luke with some Gutsy survival skills. The next day they are found and Luke gets thawed out. Also an imperial probe droid crashes the party and is blown away at Hans blaster skills.The rebels engage the empire and admiral piett's fleet as Vader presses him to a promotion , squeezing out admiral Ozzel. The rebel ion cannon gets everyone but Han and Leia out , however they blast off in the falcon as Luke flys off to meet a swamp dwelling muppet far , far away.The falcon pursued by the imperial carnival cruise liner out wits their fighter pilots and manages to hide in an asteroid field in spite of the odds being 3,750 to 1 anyone would deliver pizza to their position. Luke arrives at Degobah and is swamped at the magnitude of his task.After setting up camp he is greeted by a local that samples his food and attempts to break his iPad and PS5..Luke discovers to his astonishment this Is Yoda the great Jedi master. Yoda says Luke cannot be Jedi. Luke says Yoda cannot cook.Han discovers suddenly his hiding place really bites , so he grits his teeth and hits the road . After getting trashed by a departing imperial cruiser he makes way to cloud city , a colony of miners who are not likely to want him there anyway. Ore,ore,ore. After his old friend Lando greets him , he promptly hits on Leia then introduces Han to a waiting Vader. Luke on Degobah has sensed his friends peril and leaves to help.Arriving at cloud city , Luke proceeds to get to the root of his feeling completely ignoring Leia and her babbling on about it being a trap as the imperial troops take her away.Lando breaks Leia free and they attempt to rescue Han only to arrive too late.Luke confronts Darth Vader. A lightsaber dual is drug on through the the station until as Luke swings for the fences Vader unhands him. The next part cuts worse. Vader is Luke's father. No wonder he has issues. Unable to face the truth Luke flings himself into yet another garbage Shute. The falcon picks him up , they out run the bad guys and Luke is given a hand by the rebel doctors before returning to sunny and glamorous Tatooine.Select " Imperial March " on Pandora and leave the theatre promptly.
reviews.heading: Galactic Dysfunction

reviews.content: This is my very first review ever and I decided to make it about my all time favorite film ever, The Empire Strikes Back. I was 14 when this sequel to George Lucas Star Wars came out and I can remember loving every second of it , even more than the original which I would have thought impossible. The continuing story line of Luke Skywalker, Han Solo, Princess Leia, Chewbacca, and R2D2 and C3PO and the introduction of Yoda and Lando as they fight Darth Vader. The characters and actors portraying them are great , the action is amazing. I love the interaction between Luke and Darth and the big reveal. Also loved the cliffhanger ending for Han with Chabba the Hut. Overall a very fun movie for all ages.
reviews.heading: Empire Strikes Back is my all time Favorite movie

reviews.content: The Empire strikes back is an excellent sequel that represents the essence of taking the best of the first part and becoming it bigger, darker and even depper in terms of character development. The movie gives us probably the most iconic scenes in the Star Wars universe and plot twist of the cinematographic world.The film takes the liberty of creating much more dynamic action scenes. Besides, the balance in the development of the story is excellent, taking the viewer on a roller coaster of emotions from start to finish. And it is that, all the elements fit perfectly at the right time; action, violence, drama and even humor.
reviews.heading: The biggest star in the Star Wars universe

reviews.content: Same weapons used to open a massive hole to escape are barely doing any damage when shooting at each other. Sword battles what you expect to see when you give kids sword toys. Dialogue almost nothing. Story predictable. Falling from higher than a skyscraper, not even a scratch. This is poor writing with no complex characters or complex history. Even GOT season 8 has better writing than this. The animal froze to death but skywalker survived despite laying done with nose/mouth exposed. Empire soldiers miss about 99.9% of the time. 8.6/8 7 for this looks more like nostalgia rather objective scoring of a screenplay, dialogue or action scenes.
reviews.heading: Overrated

reviews.content: This is the epitome of sci-fi movie making. It's a classic, a tale that thrusts the audience into a world completely unlike their own. We love it not just for the famous twist, not just for the cultural impact it has and had on society, but simply for the story and the ground-breaking special effects, one should easily be able to see how much of an achievement this film is.It's a gripping sequel to the story that started it all. It's starts off of a cliffhanger, and ends with an even bigger one, leaving the audience wanting more. I only wish I could travel back in time to see it in theaters when it was first released.
reviews.heading: Even though my review will be lost in the mass of others, I have to voice my opinion of how much a classic this is

reviews.content:
I think I just found the most overrated movie in mankind's history.It's totally a mystery how grown up people can enjoy Star Wars. I think it just comes from nostalgia.When I criticize this movie, for example, "the plot was so simple and stupid" or " the creatures were created in a very unrealistic and ridiculous way," they always say to me, "c'mon, it's a movie for children."
But if this is a children's movie, why you guys are so triggered when someone doesn't like this movie? Deep down, you all know that this movie is totally crap, but just can't admit it to yourselves.By the way, I have to say that Chewbacca's voice is the most irritating voice I've ever heard. It literally raped my ears for 2 hours long.
reviews.heading: o v e r r a t e d

reviews.content: When you talk about sequels that don't suck this is one of them. The 2nd movie to the original Star Wars trilogy was always my go to and most watch over the original movie.This film takes off right after the original and this movie have great acting, music, special effects and twist that still shock you. TESB is truly one of the rare films that could say is too Perfect. Love the battle scenes and the fight with Luke and Darth Vader. Especially we got Yoda training Luke to become a Jedi. Most of all no Comedy that gets in the way is all serious story and to the point.My part is the start to.
reviews.heading: Sequel Greatness

reviews.content: Somehow this second movie in the series feels better. Less of a messy movie, but more of an adventure sci-fi with new characters both the master of Darth Vader and Yoda are seen in this movie which has a bit more of a Lord of the Rings and Labyrinth (David Bowie) kinda feelings.The princess from previous movie doesn't feel princess anymore, but more a crew member, although her cool outfits have been sacrificed for this change. The droids from previous movie feel more in place. And there is character development for the main character after in the previous movie he was just a guy.The whole politics doesn't suck me into the movie, but it all looks better and the pace is higher, so I will give it a 6.
reviews.heading: Sequel to the first famous movie

reviews.content: What can I say about "The Empire Strikes Back" that hasn't already been said? This film takes everything great about "A New Hope" and elevates it. The cinematography, the setting, the characters, the story, everything is crisp and succinct in "Empire". There were multiple times (3 to be exact) that I had full body chills, all because of the brilliant marriage of story, score and performance.This movie shows that the "galaxy far, far away" is more than just Tatooine and the Death Star. From Hoth to Dagpbah to Cloud City, "Empire" helps expand the Star Wars Universe. By traveling to different parts of the galaxy, the film physically separates the three leads. Even though apart, their connection remains strong with the force (and their incredible chemistry) binding them together. Their individual journeys have purpose and the addition of new supporting characters (Yoda, Lando, etc.) are legendary.If this film failed, Star Wars would not be the legendary franchise that it is today. Simply put, "The Empire Strikes Back" is top tier cinema.Additional Note: The three "chill-worthy" moments were 1. Yoda raising the ship. 2. THE reveal. 3. Realizing the force connection between the siblings.
reviews.heading: Top Tier Cinema

reviews.content: When the movie first came out in 1980, fans and critics weren't a big fan over the films more mature tones compared to Star Wars (1977). But since then, critics and fans, including i, have redeemed the movie as the best Star Wars movie, and one of my favorite, sci-fi, and sequel movies, and one of my personal favorites. It is alongside with Terminator 2: Judgment Day and Aliens (1986), one of the greatest sequels of all time. The movie looks better than most CGI-Hollywood films today, and this was made in 1980!, and was made entirely without CGI. The movie stars Mark Hamill, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher, Billy Dee Williams, Anthony Daniels, David Prowse, Kenny Baker, Peter Mayhew, and Frank Oz. 10/10, totally recommend it, to every movie fan.
reviews.heading: The Best Star Wars Film

reviews.content: It's obvious to most movie fans that Star Wars Episode IV deserves tons of praise for being the first in its respective series and also for spawning one of the biggest cultural phenomenons of all time, but in my view, The Empire Strikes Back is superior. I have seen someone state this already, but I will say it again here, as it is a very good reason why this movie is arguably better: character development. We get introduced to the main cast in A New Hope, but even by the end of that film, they're not fully fleshed out yet. We never really get to see how adept Luke is at using The Force, and Darth Vader, one of the most feared men in the galaxy, appears completely subservient to Peter Cushing's character, Grand Moff Tarkin. Episode V takes Star Wars in a risky direction, as Luke is separated from his friends for most of the runtime, but this decision totally paid off and I don't think the movie could have gone any better. The story picks up 3 whole years after Luke has destroyed the Death Star: the Empire's feared space station capable of obliterating entire planets. Darth Vader and Emperor Palpatine, the two most powerful men in the Empire, send floating droids all over the galaxy to locate the secret base of the Rebel Alliance (the empire's enemy), under the command of Luke's sister Princess Leia (Carrie Fisher). Vader eventually finds what he's looking for and locates what looks like a stronghold on the frigid planet of Hoth. Luke Skywalker (Mark Hamill) is investigating an area around the rebel base and is attacked and nearly killed by a yeti-esque creature called a Wampa. Luke manages to slice off one of its arms with his lightsaber and is then rescued by Han Solo (Harrison Ford). Before being saved, Luke sees a vision of his late trainer, Obi-Wan (Alec Guinness) telling him to travel to a planet called Dagobah for some reason. Confident they have the rebel base in their sights, the Imperials launch a brutal onslaught on it using huge, walking, mechanized assault vehicles called AT AT's that decimate everything in their path. Luke and a few other rebels pilot rather slow spaceships known as snowspeeders in order to destroy the imperial walkers by tying their legs with tow cables and then blasting the weak armor on their neck joints. Despite their best efforts, the base is hit too hard and has to evacuate. Leia, Han, C-3PO, Chewbacca and R2D2 pile into the Millennium Falcon, Solo's rather mediocre but dependable starship, and fly off just as Vader enters the hangar. Luke doesn't regroup with his allies right away, and instead flies to the planet Dagobah as Obi-Wan's ghost told him to. Upon arriving in the planet's atmosphere, he loses control of his X-Wing and crashes into a swamp. Here, he meets Yoda, a centuries old Jedi Master who trains Luke in the way of the force. While Han and the others try to elude Vader's fleet of ships and star destroyers by weaving through asteroid fields, Luke expresses frustration at the difficulty of his training. He knows the force seems to be a magical aura of divine, supernatural energy that surrounds everything and inhabits all living beings, but he is not willing to put up with the time required to bend it to his will. Yoda makes things easier for him and uses his mastery over the force to easily lift Luke's crashed spaceship out of the swamp using only his mind. Luke quits his training early to pursue his friends to a planet called Bespin, since he can tell they're walking into a trap. Concurrently, Han Solo and the others arrive at Cloud City on bespin; a huge floating metropolis situated entirely in the sky. There, they meet Lando Calrissian (Billy Dee Williams), who is a no good smuggler (like Han) and an old acquaintance of his. While on cloud city, Lando reveals to the group that he's actually betrayed them to the empire. Vader, accompanied by the ruthless bounty hunter Boba Fett, take Han to a specialized chamber where he is frozen in carbonite so Boba can transport him to Jabba the Hutt for a reward. As the group (minus Solo) tries to fight their way out of cloud city, Luke comes face to face with Vader. Even with the force training he has received, Luke is no match for the dark lord's lightsaber proficiency and powerful strikes. Vader corners Luke, severs his hand, and reveals he is actually his father. Vader wants his son to join him so they can kill Palpatine together and end this galactic war, but Luke refuses and lets himself fall down a waste disposal chute that leads directly out of cloud city. Barely managing to hang on to a flimsy piece of metal, Leia senses something isn't right and flies underneath cloud city to rescue her brother. The ship jumps to hyperspace, slipping out of Vader's grasp once again. Back on a rebel medical ship, Luke receives an artificial right hand, and Lando promises to look for his friend Solo. Aside from the fact that this is a star wars movie, there are no doubt a ton of other reasons why it is worthy of adoration. Probably the most visually obvious reason are the special effects. Despite being over 4 decades old, this movie still looks great, and the effects will always look good no matter what year it is. The battle on hoth is amazing. We see the empire's enormous AT AT tanks, and how even their footsteps cause destruction. We see the millennium falcon get chased by massive, dagger shaped spaceships. Most of all, we see much appreciated character development. Luke still hasn't mastered all his force powers by the end of this movie, but he's come a long way thanks to Yoda. Speaking of which, Frank Oz did a great job puppeteering him and basically created one of cinema's most beloved characters. Even the villains are interesting and likable. Vader I believe needs no introduction, but he contrasts heavily with how he was in the first film. He's completely in control here and does what he wants, unlike in episode IV where Tarkin bosses him around, and episode VI where Palpatine does. While still a cool bad guy, it's always annoyed me how Boba Fett is consistently ranked as one of star wars' most popular characters, mostly just because of how he looks. He only has 4 lines in this entire movie, but he's still memorable for being one of the few people who can talk back to Vader and still be alive afterwards. It's not like I need to state the obvious, but John Williams' score really serves to make an epic film even more epic. All I have to say for my closing remark is that The Empire Strikes Back has clearly secured its place as one of the most well made star wars films, which should be common knowledge for any fan of this immortal franchise.
reviews.heading: "It is your destiny"

reviews.content: In this Episode V the prologue has much more logic. It's a good context for the beginning of the film and not an omission of a sequence that cannot be allowed.The first act is a vast improvement over the previous film. Contains a situation that demonstrates Han Solo's friendship and loyalty to Luke. Although the situation is quite irrelevant to the full story.There is a fair amount of humor from the Chewbacca and Solo duo. C3PO is unbearable, he adds absolutely nothing to the plot. Very annoying character.The first half of the movie is fast-paced and full of action. Great sequences of battles between small spaceships, giant quadrupedal vehicles and the rebel infantry in the snow. Good performance of stop motion techniques and the use of chroma key, although there are still several details that could be improved, however much less than in the previous film. The visual effects like explosions and moving lights are still not convincing except for the holograms, which are very well done.There is greater care in the details of the interior sets, with a notable injection of budget, which allows for new, better and larger settings.The second half of the film is much slower paced, allowing for suspense and significant character development. Yoda is one of the greatest characters of the saga, but he's also one of the worst presented characters. It's already difficult to assimilate the importance in the plot that a puppet can have, but it's even more so if they present it with a childish, curious and even reckless attitude. Luckily, this was just a facade and it only lasts a few minutes, revealing himself later as he really is, the great Jedi Master.The great final battle between Luke and Darth Vader is very good. It begins with unnecessary slowness, but ends with entirely appropriate ferocity, full of emotions and crowned with one of the most iconic plot twists in cinema.The big problems of the first film are resolved and forgotten. The soundtrack is impeccable, the montage is a good complement to a quite entertaining script. In short, the change in direction is remarkable and the film's reputation is clearly justified, although it's not a masterpiece either.
reviews.heading: The film's reputation is clearly justified, although it's not a masterpiece either

reviews.content: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back, or as some might call it "Empire" is widely considered to be one of the greatest film sequels of all time. Following up from the original Star Wars, The Empire Strikes Back continues the saga with what is the second film of the trilogy. From repeatedly re-watching it over the years, it's come to my attention that Empire is very different in comparison to the rest of the films. Sure it has its humor and all, but overall it's much more dramatic. My favorite films are those that depict the story before it has been shown, and the title alone, clearly foreshadows what's to expect in this film. It reveals a tragedy in which we see the first glimpse of victory for the Galactic Empire since the fall of the dreaded Death Star.If there's one thing I've noticed with Empire, it's that it's more of a 'darker' film that is particularly shown through the perspective of Darth Vader. After only 8 minutes of screen time in Star Wars, Empire has really given us the chance to delve into his backstory, and really understand more about the mysterious figure behind the mask. I say figure because he has no formal identity, and we as the audience are given the challenge of making our own assumptions. As we've come to expect, Darth Vader is intriguingly more involved during this installment, as his intimidating demeanor continues to shroud our interpretation of the character, and his relationships with other characters, in particular Luke, which is quite the treat and one of the most captivating moments of the whole film. They really couldn't have selected a better, more talented actor than James Earl Jones, who I feel doesn't receive as much recognition for the role than he deserves. With all due respect to the great David Prowse who did great in the suit, Jones truly enlightens the character. His voice is really special, and a lot of aspiring actors look up to him.Throughout the film we also explore the relationship between Leia and Han and how their story becomes a core part of this film, and the introduction to so many new and loving characters such as Lando and Yoda, including countless planets which continue to expand. Of course, I can't write a review without the mentioning of John Williams. What a wonderful job once again with the classic score of this film, which I would say is better than the first score. Its truly amazing how music can create such emotion so powerful that only the goosebumps on my arms can describe it. There is simply not enough words in the vocabulary that can truly capture its meaning. Not to mention the people working at ILM. They are the magicians in film. Film is visual effects, the two interconnect with each other, and without the visuals there is no film, and the visual effects have significantly improved since the first film and are truly spectacular - a work of art, that really immerses you into the experience.There are so many more people to appreciate, during the making of this film, none more than George Lucas of course, but also Irvin Kershner. He has incredible vision. His level of passion for the franchise and the way in which he interpreted the film has won me over, to the point in which I would argue, Empire is the greatest film of the trilogy and the franchise, and that is not an easy feat to accomplish. Empire has laid foundations for future movie sequels in which many of them follow that same formula.Compelling narratives, dark tone, deep character developments, Empire has it all. I like it when films 'strangle you', you know really keep you into it, and Empire has done just that. There is no other film (apart from the first film) that has had such a profound impact on my life, and I'll forever appreciate the pioneers behind the scenes. It is a film of the ages, and a must watch. There is so much more to say about this film, but the rest is for you for you decide. 5/5!!!
reviews.heading: When Everything Clicks

reviews.content: Luke Skywalker (Mark Hamill), Han Solo (Harrison Ford), Princess Leia (Carrie Fisher) and Chewbacca (Peter Mayhew) face attack by the Imperial forces and its AT-AT walkers on the ice planet Hoth. While Han and Leia escape in the Millennium Falcon, Luke travels to Dagobah in search of Yoda. Only with the Jedi master's help will Luke survive when the dark side of the Force beckons him into the ultimate duel with Darth Vader (David Prowse).This has to be my favourite Star Wars movie out of them all! This movie does everything way better than the first with great character Development will all characters and the introduction of 2 new characters, a smuggler from Hans past and a badass bounty hunter. The most has great special effects and a great musical score by John Williams again! The sets are so good to look at and the characters are so much more likeable in this movie!The movie also becomes way more darker than the last one.Mark Hamill does a way better job playing Luke even becoming more likeable. Carrie Fisher is still the likeable princess from the first one. Harrison Ford is still as likeable from the first one and him and Leia relationship is way more drawn out. Chewbacca is hilarious in this movie. Billy Dee Williams is a welcomed addition to this movie! James Earl Jones is menacing Vader!Overall this is the best Star Wars movie to date!
reviews.heading: Even better than the first one!

reviews.content: An amazing sequel my dad loves and I mean love's this movie I think it is pretty good but I don't think it's as good as a new Hope new Hope is a classic but still a really good movie.
reviews.heading: Incredibles

reviews.content: This is a lot more dark in comparison to Ep IV, but doesn't seem quite so much of an adjustment with consideration to prequel elements, both dark and light. This one has lost a little of it's edge in light of moods that have proceeded it in later prequels. At the time of release, an easy 10/10, on account of the dramatic shift, however it's lost some of that punch in the wake of new material, which is a shame. It's still however an excellent movie, and one of the best in the whole franchise. We got a better lightsabre battle this time around too, towards the end - beats the Obi Wan v Vader sequence in the last movie, by a long way!
reviews.heading: Darker, but...

reviews.content: In the second movie in the Star Wars trilogy, Darth Vader continues to hunt down the rebellion base.This was disappointing for a Star Wars movie. The plot was not that exciting, and I mostly hated the ridiculous Yoda scenes, as well as the Leia / Solo romance. I struggle to think of good bits but there are a couple of memorable scenes.
reviews.heading: Disappointing for Star Wars

reviews.content: It is surprisingly better than I thought. It was action packed, keeping you on your toes throughout the film. However, it was just that. Nothing really stood out to me and simply said, it was just not very emotional. Perhaps this can also be attributed to the fact that even before watching this film, I already know about the spoilers given that I'm watching this so many years after the very famous plot twist occurred. Even so, I must say that there were some instances which I felt were very well done. For example, C3PO's cooks and witty comments help to bring a little laughter and charm into this otherwise bleak and sad film.
reviews.heading: Decently interesting

reviews.content: Following the events of the last film, Luke Skywalker (Mark Hamill), Han Solo (Harrison Ford), Chewbacca (Peter Mayhew),Princess Leia (Carrie Fisher), their droids R2 (Kenny Baker) and C-3PO (Anthony Daniels), and the rest of the rebel alliance have been driven into hiding on the ice planet Hoth after their destruction of the Death Star. Darth Vader(physical: David Prowse, voice: James Earl Jones) continues his search for Skywalker and eventually finds the rebel base with the rebel forces forced to retreat and Luke is separated while Han and the others attempt to elude pursuit of the Empire. Luke travels to the Dagobah system at the direction of his deceased master Obi-Wan (Alec Guinness) and directs Luke to locate his former master Yoda. As Luke dives deeper into the teachings of the Jedi and The Force, Luke's friends will face a danger that will force Luke to make a choice that could lead him to the Dark Side and discover revelations that challenge everything he's learned.George Lucas had always planned to expand Star Wars even if the first film proved unsuccessful down to contracting author Alan Dean Foster who wrote the novelization of Star Wars to write a limited location sequel novel that could be adapted on a low budget released as Splinter of the Mind's Eye. When Star Wars broke Box Office Records, Lucas reappraised his approach to the sequel leaving the Foster adaptation as novel (which became a success in its own right and the start of the Expanded Universe) and proceeding to plan a much more ambitious sequel. Lucas having felt the strain of directing Star Wars opted to take a role as Executive Producer and instead handed the reins to Irvin Kershner. The script received a lot of input from multiple parties as Lucas had many different ideas on how to approach the subject of Luke's father (who was not yet the reveal we know), Luke's sister (also originally a new character), and expanded roles for the Galactic Emperor and other planets which weren't deemed feasible. The script was given multiple passes by several writers including notably Lawrence Kasdan who had impressed Lucas with his work on Raiders of the Lost Ark. Upon initial release some critics were mixed in the darker tone from the original film with some outright lambasting the film, but overtime The Empire Strikes Back has been re-evaluated as not just the best film in the series, but one of the best sequels of all time.From the movie's introduction, it makes it clear to the audience that while the destruction of the Death Star was a victory slowing the threat of the Empire, it didn't stop them as the Rebels are forced to hide on the desolate ice planet of Hoth while Vader searches the galaxy intent on finding Luke. The harshness of the ice world is a fantastic setup with its bitter and inhospitable cold serving as a nice counterpoint to the original desert planet we saw in Star Wars and gives us the feeling of a new and unfamiliar place we've not yet explored. The characters also feel like they've advanced with Luke Skywalker carrying a more hardened demeanor in contrast to the fresh faced youth we were introduced to him as and Han and Leia have both advanced with the two developing a relationship and Han having become less cynical and self-serving as a character. The movie keeps itself mostly pretty simple with Luke embarking on a journey of self-discovery with Jedi master Yoda voiced and puppeted by Frank Oz and the character is a solid mixture of quirky, weird, and wise that makes him a unique mentor figure for Luke to play off against. The action scenes have also been expanded upon with a larger scale and more ambitious effects with the Battle of Hoth sequence featuring some great computer assisted Stop Motion to bring to life walking battle tanks called "Walkers" that look amazing in motion as well as destruction. We also get Billy Dee Williams as Han's former friend Lando who plays the role with the same cocky swagger as Han but still gives his own spin on it and gets some good moments in the film as a character. Darth Vader remains a solid antagonist in the film with his menace dialed up as the primary antagonist this time around, but also some solid revelations that are now famous (you know what I'm talking about) and some terrific pitch black humor of Darth Vader "promoting" various officers to Admiral after the previous one failed him.The Empire Strikes Back is a great film in its own right and one of the best sequels of all time. The characters you loved the first time around are expanded upon and revisited and the world is made to feel alive and bigger with new environments and world building that make the film an engaging sit even when you know what's coming.
reviews.heading: The sequel to the groundbreaking Star Wars revisits everything that worked the first time while upping the stakes and refining the rough spots.

reviews.content: First I watched the episodes 1,2,3,7,8,9, then I watched the oldest movies. To be honest I didn't like the original trio. Prequels are better. I find the movie a bit boring comparing to the new ones. The plot is not very complex nor interesting. And because they are old, the aliens and the special effects look fake.
reviews.heading: Meh

reviews.content: "New Hope" showed the whole world that fiction can be adventurous, fun, and new worlds, as George Lucas showed, need further disclosure. A new film was needed that would continue the story of the confrontation between a small army of rebels and an unshakable and gloomy Empire led by Darth Vader. The fans got such a movie.The very title reveals the essence of the upcoming conflict. The Empire and its Death Star had suffered a crushing defeat, which meant that a retaliatory strike was needed, a step that would make the rebels lose. And this film perfectly demonstrates how the stakes are rising in this legendary confrontation.The main characters have matured noticeably, they have grown up, become more serious. Their characters are perfectly shown in the events that surround them. It seems that the actions in the previous movie were like a starting point. Now each of the heroes chooses his own unique path. Luke Skywalker, as the main character, decides to become what he did not think a few years ago - a Jedi, a warrior of light, who once and for all must defeat evil in the person of Vader and Emperor Sidious, who is still flashing in the background. Obi-Wan Kenobi's self-sacrifice seems to have made him an adult overnight, made him feel indebted to this old teacher. And then Luke accepts this burden of fate, intending to fight to the last.Leia Organa and Han Solo are testing the strength of their fragile relationship so far, they do not want to give in to each other. All this happens against the background of the struggle with the imperial armies and a series of betrayals, when it turns out that friends can no longer be trusted. In the maelstrom of events, news comes under the finale, which is now fashionable to call a "twist". This is an event that turns out unexpectedly, something that turns the whole narrative upside down or vice versa. The history of Star Wars was probably one of the first to show this technique in the cinema. This is remembered for many years, and the play of the actors (those who saw it will understand which actor and what situation I'm talking about) amazes with its sincerity and literally makes the audience tremble from the discovery that happened.However, this seemingly gloomy picture is not devoid of positive interesting moments. Huge Wookiees, droids and ridiculous situations allow you to dilute this tragic story of one family.The creators of the picture skillfully use the technologies available at that time, which enable viewers to see and, most importantly, believe in the reality of those worlds that are shown to us on the screen. All this is flavored with excellent dialogues, colorful characters and a wonderful musical component. What the Imperial March that appeared here is worth, which for decades will become the personification of the yoke of evil, the approaching dangerous Darth Vader.The creators perfectly show several storylines and interactions between the characters at once. There is a love relationship, and the relationship between mentor and student, a test of friendly feelings. And each of the lines is successfully woven into the overall plot, makes you empathize and see yourself in these diverse characters, understand their motives, agree or not with their opinion."The Empire strikes back" makes it possible to leave our native Land and go on an unprecedented journey, makes you throw away your earthly experiences, understand how much brighter and more dynamic life can be, because it is in a galaxy far, far away, where events happened a long time ago. Cinema will allow you to ask a lot of questions about the meaning of life, about relationships, about the world, which is not only black and white. The world is multifaceted, with its own complexities and ambiguity. And, most importantly, this film will encourage you to see the next one, the one that will complete the classic trilogy and finally put all the dots on the "E" for these heroes.9 out of 10.
reviews.heading: The Retaliatory move of Darth Vader and the Empire

reviews.content: Empire Strikes Back takes everything done by A New Hope and improves upon it and it's during these two hours we see the most development for our main characters. All the substantial characters go on a journey in this film where we see just what they'd fight for and why. But more on that later.At the start of ESB we see the rebels still under attack by the empire despite taking out the Death Star in the last film. The first act on Hoth is brilliant with such iconic images such as the AT-ATs crushing rebels underfoot. We also get to see our characters start to really build their bonds with each other as Han and Leia start their eventual romance as well as Han and Chewbacca carry On to be a dynamic duo. We also see Han start to show his true colours when he is the only one to take the journey to go and save Luke when he's stranded on the ice.The second act of the film sees Luke leave his friends to go and train with Yoda while Han, Leia and Chewbacca are on the run from the empire. While not a lot substantial happens with the trio, it's the scenes with Luke and Yoda that give us the important insight. We see that a once great Jedi Master is reduced to a hermit because he failed to stop Darth Vader and his master the emperor. These are important for the audience later when Luke goes to fight Vader as we see Luke has only had a few days worth of training compared to Yoda who studied for years.The final act comes to a head on Cloud City where Han is betrayed by his old friend Lando and sold out to the empire, laying the trap for Luke. This is also the part where Luke makes his decision of what means more to him: his friends or becoming a Jedi like his father. He chooses the former despite being told he isn't ready which leads to the duel on Bespin.The final duel between Luke and Vader is one that also has iconic moments and for good reason. We see that Vader doesn't try during this duel whereas Luke puts in all of his effort to defeat the dark lord echoing the point Yoda made earlier about Luke not being ready to face Vader and from the choreography we can clearly see this is the case. The climax of this duel results in Luke losing a hand and having his reality crushed around him as he learns that Vader is his father. This is a powerful reveal purely based on what it means to Luke, someone who has spent years wondering who his father was and then being told he was a great man and arguably the reason why Luke would want to become a Jedi. While you could argue him screaming "NO" is over the top, I love it due to the fact Luke sees his idol is in reality the epitome of evil.So what journeys are taken by our characters.Leia learns that she loves Han and wants to be with him, dropping her sassy and bossy nature when things turn dire to be vulnerable and confess her feelings to him.Luke discovers he's willing to drop all his ideas of being a Jedi and fight Vader due to his reckless nature to save the people who are his family by this point.Lando decides to put the people of cloud city first but then realises what a fatal error he makes and decides to save Han.Han goes through the best out of them all In my opinion where our rogue who can't wait to leave the rebellion decides to stay having found people who he cares for and have his back.Empire Strikes Back is a masterpiece and an iconic piece of cinema. It carries on the plot of the last film while testing our characters and asking them "what would you fight for?" However, the best is yet to come. 10/10.
reviews.heading: What would you fight for?

reviews.content: Second chapter that can be defined as a transition between the first and the last, is a chapter full of plot but in any case of passage, useful only for the construction of the final phase of the saga.

reviews.content: So good. Star Wars A New Hope was amazing when it came out. So the hype around The Empire Strikes Back was huge. But wow, this film was awesome. The film did everything that made the first film great and added with it. From the iconic twist, to introducing new characters such as Bobba Fett, Lando Calrissian and the other bounty hunters. It added on so many new things and it worked great. Overall this is a classic film that everyone should watch, Star Wars fan or not, the original trilogy is a must watch for everyone.
reviews.heading: Flawless.........

reviews.content: It's not easy making a sequel to a hit movie, especially when Episode 5 was being made as sequels were not as common. So, it goes without saying that no one knew what to expect.Written by George Lucas and directed by Irvin Kershner, Episode 5 takes place not too long after it's predecessor. The Rebellion is still fighting the Empire as they just barely manage to escape from another battle as Luke is sent to be trained by one of Obi-Wans former teachers, Yoda. Han, Leia and Chewbacca are on the run from the Empire and are forced to seek help from an old friend of Hans, Lando, as their ship is damaged.Meanwhile, Darth Vader is not only hunting for them but Luke as well. We see him go to great lengths to find them and eventually threatens Lando to turn them in.All the while, Luke finally finds Yoda and proceeds with his Jedi training. However, he senses the danger everyone is in and leaves Yoda to save them. During this time, Han is frozen and taken away and Lando helps Leia and Chewbacca escape. Luke arrives and duels with Darth Vader, not only losing the battle but discovering that Vader is indeed Anakin Skywalker, his father.The combination of Kershner and Lucas is one that I'm sure fans (myself included) wanted more often. This is not only the easiest Star Wars to follow but also the most down to earth. Kershner helps ground Lucas' broad imagination, making not only the settings more realistic but the characters more relatable.The story is expertly paced, leaving little to no filler within the film. Every moment matters, and none is wasted on needless visuals, something Lucas is notorious for.The characters are given unbelievable depth, with Darth Vader probably being the most intriguing. Even when not factoring in the prequels and recent season finale of Kenobi, Vader's presence and power is on another level when compared to Episode 4 and learning of his connection to Luke makes him even more interesting.I also love the love triangle between Luke, Han and Leia. Yes I know what the third film will reveal but it not only helps establish the dilemma between the three but it also makes their relationship appear stronger, especially with Han and Luke, as they still will do anything to help one another.The action is splendid. The effects still look tremendous and like I said before, they aren't just there to look cool, they help tell the story.The acting in this film is why I really wish Kershner was kept on for later films, including Episodes 2 and 3. He not only allows a lot more improvisation and leeway with the scripting but makes sure that each actor delivers their all with each take.So overall, this is the perfect Star Wars movie. My wife, who absolutely hates Star Wars, watched this movie for the first time all the way through and loved it. Definitely in the top five for films that should be watched by everybody.
reviews.heading: The Perfect Sequel

reviews.content: After the sensation that Star Wars was, it would seem impossible to make a worthy follow up but somehow Lucas and his team did. In fact, there's a strong argument to be made that Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back even surpassed its predecessor and is the best of the franchise/hexalogy. While I may not propound that myself, I couldn't exactly reject it either. All I can add is it does contain the best cinematography of all the films, courtesy of Peter Suschitzky.
reviews.heading: Possibly The Best

Although the Death Star has been destroyed, Imperial troops have driven the Rebel forces from their hidden base and pursued them across the galaxy.Evading the dreaded Imperial Starfleet, a group of freedom fighters led by Luke Skywalker has established a new secret base on the remote ice world of Hoth.The evil lord Darth Vader, obsessed with finding young Skywalker, has dispatched thousands of remote probes into the far reaches of space....
